text.__SUMMARY__: Salvia trachyphylla is a species of flowering plant in the family Lamiaceae that is native to Ecuador. Its natural habitats are subtropical or tropical moist montane forests and subtropical or tropical high-altitude shrubland.
text.Sources: Montúfar, R. & Pitman, N. (2004). "Salvia trachyphylla". The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. IUCN. 2004: e.T45579A11001269. doi:10.2305/IUCN.UK.2004.RLTS.T45579A11001269.en. Retrieved 18 December 2017.
